topics.body:
So apparently Obama's getting serious about Syria; he wants 500 million for the rebels to train them.  It's not the usa becoming directly involved, rather say hello to a proxy war.

Well fook me; here comes another government shutdown.  This time over something incredibly fucking stupid; the import-export bank.  The fact you've never heard of it proves how stupid this is.  The import-export bank essentially is a short term loan bank for companies that want to invest in american companies.  It's a extremely limited bank and has little to no effect on anything; it's just a short term loan bank.  Republicans are trying to shut down the entire government over a bank that unimportant.  You know what's stupid about it as well?  If the bank was shut down 250k people would lose their jobs.

So basically Republicans are making a shitstorm out of a molehill. . . At this point I don't even think they believe their rhetoric anymore; they're probably just looking to start shit to make it look like they're doing something.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac78e86368724c0d620100#post_53ac78e86368724c0d620100
[bq="uc9"]!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/783/156/c63.png![/bq]
WHAT?

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac7e776368724cb2870200#post_53ac7e776368724cb2870200
The import-export bank is a vestige.
It can go.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac81fe6368724c93a20400#post_53ac81fe6368724c93a20400
Yeah; I know; my point is that they want to completely and totally shut down the entire government with no set date on how long it'll be shut down if they don't get their way over such a small organization is utterly fucking ridiculous.

It's like someone shutting down a entire city's basic utilities just cause you don't like a traffic light at one intersection not being replaced with a stop sign instead.

*TOTAL FUCKING OVER REACTION BY THE REPUBLICANS*

What's next shutting down the education system cause you don't like kids drinking soda at school?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac83716368724c44fe0400#post_53ac83716368724c44fe0400
Government shutdowns barely affect anything. Just a humdrum reminder that for all its bluster the government only does a few things well enough to justify it being responsible for them.

Although, if I were the Reps, I would basically let them dems do what they want and watch to see what happens.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac86de6368724b76130600#post_53ac86de6368724b76130600
What about the people that don't get paid as a result?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac884263687273f52a0000#post_53ac884263687273f52a0000
The beast is too big and overbearing as it is.
If you agree the import-export bank should go then you already agree that people shouldn't be getting paid.

I could easily argue, what of the people who are having their money taken to finance their jobs?
It's ultimately a game of one-upping who gets shorted that accomplishes nothing.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac8964636872724a5e0000#post_53ac8964636872724a5e0000
I never said whether or not the import-export bank should go; I said that I find it fucking ridiculous that they're going to shut down the government over such a minor thing.  I'm thinking about this in a objective standpoint; shutting down a entire government over one loan bank is fucking ridiculous; you're thinking about it in a moralistic perspective of who's right and whose wrong.  The problem with using the moralistic perspective for everything is that it's subjective and therefore any argument will be subjective.

Shutting down a entire government over a organization of only four hundred people is fucking ridiculous.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac8b2663687273ced20000#post_53ac8b2663687273ced20000
well I did say I would have gone with the "agree and amplify" strategy so I don't really disagree tactically.

I just don't find the argument of job loss to be particularly compelling in the context of making cuts to the gov
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac8c1063687272e47d0100#post_53ac8c1063687272e47d0100
If the republicans wanted to get rid of the import-export bank then they should have just proposed a bill in congress to do so instead throwing a tantrum like a five year old going, "If I don't get what I want then no one gets what they want" and then going around breaking everyone's favorite toys.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac8d0763687274c0cf0100#post_53ac8d0763687274c0cf0100
which is why I prefer the agree and amplify strat.

They did the same thing as they are doing now with some other budgetary thing and by doing so took attention away from how badly the dems bungled the budget and put the spotlight on themselves.
Dumb idea.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ac8db063687273ceb50100#post_53ac8db063687273ceb50100
Eh; personally I think how the budget is done is completely ass backwards.  It should be handled by a permanent committee to determine what department needs what and how much they have to work with then negotiate with the other departments.  Just like a group of people representing each department and working it out over the year.

"Ted how much does homeland security need for the first quarter?"
"At least $150 billion"
"Andy how much does nasa need?"
"A whole lot more than we are getting"
"Crud; well how much do we have to work with?"
". . . Not enough"
"We need to figure this out before the next year"
. . . . . .
"Okay; so we've sorted it out and while no one got exactly 100% of what they wanted we at least made enough concessions to where we can at least function.  Is this okay with everyone?"
*grumbling disgruntled tones of agreement
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
